description: Triple oated, giving a smooth, chocolatey stout with a hint of roasted coffee.
Pronounced Our Mellys - Sweet Gold in Welsh. Sweet and mellow with a golden hue and soft malt finish. Very moreish and sessionable.
A vibrant pale ale with juicy notes of passionfruit and tangerine, layered over sweet biscuity malts and a touch of pine and earthy truffle.
Mid-amber with toffee and nutty aroma. Balanced bitterness and sweetness with a long, satisfying finish.
A modern take on a classic bitter with caramel and biscuit malt character, balanced by grassy, herbal Fuggle hops.
Dark and smooth with chocolate and coffee notes. A velvety mild with gentle bitterness.
A bold Black IPA with roasted malt, chocolate, and coffee notes balanced by assertive hop bitterness; dark, complex, and smooth.
A crisp and easy-drinking golden ale with light malt sweetness and subtle floral hops; refreshing and balanced.
Smooth and mellow with hints of honey and biscuit malt. Easy-drinking and delicately balanced.
Light and fruity with a crisp finish from Styrian Golding hops. Easy-drinking and refreshing.
English-hopped red ale with a subtle caramel backbone and a dry, balanced finish.
Pale and refreshing with a gentle bitterness and soft malt sweetness.
Crisp and light with hints of lemon zest and a soft floral bitterness.
Dark ruby with roast barley and chocolate notes. Smooth and complex — a year-round favourite.
Light amber with creamy smoothness and a refreshing, cleansing finish. Subtle fruit and malt balance make it a proper quaffing ale.
A pioneering UK session IPA brewed with 100% Citra hops; expect explosive grapefruit and lemon zest on a crisp golden malt base, finishing dry and hoppy.
Deep amber with a light hoppy aroma and rounded malt character. Clean, smooth, and supremely drinkable.
Malty and smooth with hints of caramel and a gentle bitterness. A solid, sessionable amber.
Dark ruby and malt-forward with nutty depth and a full-bodied finish. Old-school and bold.
A classic English bitter with copper colour, bready malt, gentle caramel, and a dry, floral finish; smooth and sessionable.
Smooth and malty with chocolate undertones and a gentle bitterness.
Rich and fruity with earthy UK hops. Balanced malt backbone and a herbal aroma.
Rich and complex with sweet malt, warming alcohol, and a heady aroma. Brewed by appointment to the Queen’s Royal Lancers.
Hoppy and vibrant with tropical fruit notes and a dry finish. A modern pale with a quirky name.
A New Zealand-hopped pale ale with subtle citrus and white grape notes; soft and juicy with a clean, refreshing finish.
A crisp session pale ale with grassy, peppery hops, grapefruit and mango notes, and a biscuity malt base; finishes dry and bitter.
Bright and crisp with stone fruit and passionfruit aroma. A seasonal brew with a clean, modern twist.
Crisp and thirst-quenching with late citrus hop aroma from Saaz and Cascade. A blonde ale built for sunny days.
Malty and mellow with caramel notes and a soft, earthy hop character.
Fruity mix of American and European hops over Belgian malt. Citrus aroma, dry finish, and caramel warmth.
Rolo-inspired stout bursting with sweet chocolate and caramel, mellowed by lactose for a smooth, decadent experience.
Light and crisp with subtle citrus and floral hop notes. A refreshing session ale brewed with Hertfordshire water.
Bright and zesty with a citrus hop burst and a crisp finish. A cheerful ale for sunny moods.
Triple-hopped and bursting with tropical fruit and citrus. Light-bodied with toasted malt sweetness.
Bold and hoppy with citrus zest and a resinous backbone. A punchy IPA for hop lovers.
A light golden ale with a big personality, bursting with fruity American hop flavours—think satsuma, peach, mango, and grapefruit—with a zesty, refreshing finish.
A modern classic with bright citrus and a dry, assertive hop finish.
Packed with passionfruit and mango, this one’s bold, sweet, and refreshingly zesty.
A smooth, light brown best bitter with gentle biscuit malt and soft hop character; expect hints of lemon, lime, raspberry, and dried fruit with a mellow bitter finish.
Robust and balanced with roasted malt and a nutty backbone.
Smooth and sweet with creamy malt and subtle fruit. Like velvet in a glass.
A heavily hopped, gluten-free pale ale with bold floral and tropical fruit aromas; expect soft lemon, mango, and a gentle bittersweet finish.
Rich mahogany ESB with chocolate and caramel notes, a touch of spice, and a pleasantly dry, fruity finish.
A rich, full-bodied old ale with deep ruby hues, offering notes of black cherry, banana, toffee, and roasted malt, with a smooth, warming finish.
A golden ale with smooth malt character and a delicate bitterness; expect notes of digestive biscuit, hedgerow herbs, and a touch of honeyed sweetness.
Citrus and fruity hops meet English barley and Bohemian malts. Biscuity, nutty, and grassy with a lemony finish.
Light-bodied and hazy with grassy hops, white grape, and a touch of citrus; refreshing and easy-drinking with a gentle bitterness.
A delightful American Pale Ale with Amarillo, Simcoe and Centennial hops, pushing notes of pine and seville orange to the forefront.
A bright, citrusy pale ale brewed with Motueka and UK hops; delivers zesty aromas, a fruity palate, and a clean, subtly bitter finish.
A well-balanced bitter with subtle fruit and malt notes, finishing with a gentle hop bitterness.
Copper-hued and malt-forward with roasted oats and piney hops. Balanced bitterness and a clean finish.
A rich, jet-black porter with aromas of chocolate and currants, flavours of black treacle and orange, and a roasty, peppery finish.
Rich amber colour with roasted malt and a hint of spice. Balanced and warming.
Balanced and bready with fruity Styrian Goldings hops. A refined, easy-drinking bitter.
A full-flavoured American IPA brewed with Mosaic and Citra hops; expect bold tropical fruit flavours like mango, lychee, and sweet grapefruit, with a piney, bitter finish.
Bright and juicy with tropical pineapple, passionfruit, and lime notes from Galaxy, Motueka, and Vic Secret hops, finishing with a crisp hint of pine.
Light gold and fresh-tasting with grapefruit and orange hop character. Balanced and easy-drinking.
A naturally hazy, super-hoppy IPA packed with Citra hops; bursting with juicy grapefruit, pineapple, and mango over a light, smooth bitterness.
Straw-coloured and hoppy with citrus and floral notes from Cascade hops. A refreshing session beer.
A light-bodied table beer with soft caramel and toast notes, lifted by autumnal orange and spice aromas; sessionable and gently bitter with a fragrant hop finish.
A lush hazy pale ale with New Zealand hops delivering ripe stone fruit, juicy mango, zesty citrus, and a soft, piney finish.
A hazy, sessionable pale ale bursting with sticky mandarin and grapefruit, finishing crisp and clean with a soft, pithy bitterness.
Bold and stormy with dark roasted malts and a tsunami of hops. Resinous, bitter, and complex.
A smooth golden ale with a full citrus aroma, floral and spicy hop character, and a caramel malt backbone; finishes long and bitter with hints of tropical fruit.
Floral and citrusy with Cascade hops. Dry finish and refreshing character — a glass of summer all year round.
A smooth golden ale with soft malt sweetness, subtle citrus, and a clean, quaffable finish; perfect for a sunny day.
Full-bodied with rich caramel and subtle rum warmth. A smooth ale with a hint of adventure.
Full-bodied and rich with roasted barley, oats, and a touch of chocolate. Light on hops, big on flavour.
Crisp and citrusy with Cascade and Summit hops. Well-balanced malt and a clean finish.
Light and refreshing with subtle fruit and a gentle bitterness. A smooth session ale.
Lemon and blood orange notes are balanced by light floral flavours and a resinous finish.
Malty and smooth with earthy hops and a touch of caramel. A classic English bitter.
